title: Goblet and cover
marks: Signature and Date on bulbous section of stem, engraved: [Willem Van
text: Glass goblets engraved with short quotations or mottoes were a quintessential expression of Dutch art in the 17th century. They added food for thought to the dinner table, sparking conversations about religious, philosophical and political subjects. The present goblet is inscribed on the bowl, "Alles heft sijn tyd. Eccles. Cap: 3.vs.I" ("There is a season for everything, Ecclesiastes, chapter 3, verse 1"), and on the cover, "INFESTUS INFESTIS," that is, "Hostile (only) to the wicked," stating an ideal of civic and national self-defense.
description: stemmed goblet with wide foot; conical shaped at top; engraved scrolls and text (in Latin?) on conical section; domed cover with similar engraved scrolls and text in block letters; organic knob; clear glass
